result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Mark Merritt

defendant.name: Merritt, Matthew Mark
defendant.address: 15221 W US Highway 63 Lot 55, Hayward, WI 54843

records.addlTxt:
11:50 AM Defendant Matthew Mark Merritt appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Matthew Mark Merritt.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Gill indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Attny Gill makes request for bond modification.  State objects modification.   Court denies bond modification request.  
Arraignment scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:44 PM Defendant Matthew Mark Merritt appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Matthew Mark Merritt.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint,  Attny Gill unable to review complaint with DEF,  Court reviews complaint.   Court sets preliminary hearing within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 11:45 am.

9:06 AM Defendant Matthew Mark Merritt appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Matthew Mark Merritt.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   DEF is requesting to meet with Attny in person prior to having initial appearance.   Court continues.  Bond Continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:49 AM Defendant Matthew Mark Merritt appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill not in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court has discussion with DEF, and reset due to non appearance of Attny Gill.   Court directs Clerk to contact Attny to contact DEF.
Bail/bond hearing on July 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:14 AM DE Matthew Merritt_in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video. Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation. (CBS $7500 with conditions)  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court gives the DEF the attorney colloquy.   Court sets bond.   CBS $6,000  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options. 

Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for August 2, 2022  at 8:30AM.
Hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
